name: 1-(phenylsulfonyl)pyrrole
Reason: 1-(phenylsulfonyl)pyrrole has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is pyrrole, which has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The sulfonyl group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The pyrrole ring itself contributes to the melting point due to its planarity and rigidity, estimated at approximately +20 degrees Celsius. The presence of a methyl group can lower the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at approximately -5 degrees Celsius.
